page.title: 02YOXTER RANGES NEAR CHEDDAR
page.content: The level land of this block lies in the Mendip Hills and is part farmland and part heath. There is no access to the heath (used as firing ranges by the Army) where the rare red-footed falcon is seen. the Mendips have lead ore and caves but here there is no mining, no obvious subsidence and only one cave - Lambs Lair. The B3134 follows the straight course of a road linking Roman mining settlements. Between fields there are either drystone walls draped with ferns or shrubby hedges with foliose lichens, demonstrating the moist atmosphere. There are some conifer plantations and old beech at Gibbets Brow but no village or any new building: two public houses at crossroads are prosperous. One Priddy circle lies in the block near a radiotransmitter and the map shows many sites of tumuli
